storyInfo: The kind Paprika runs food to a Sarkaz pub owner in Norport amidst the chaos. Logos and the Damazti Cluster delve into a debate on civilization and survival.

attributes.content: Stay away! All of you stay away!
attributes.name: Timid Citizen

attributes.content: This gutless man suddenly pulls out something and brandishes it in the air. It's a fountain pen, and even in the dark, you can tell clearly just how fancy it's decorated.
He's a scholar of heraldry, claims he could be the next Fellow of the Royal Victorian Academy of Science. Maybe that's the pen from which all sorts of marvelous criticisms used to flow.
But now, it's just a pathetic, utterly shameful weapon, clutched in a trembling hand.
With a clatter, a can falls out from his coat, which he hastily stoops to pick back up and hide again under his layers.
Sir, that's our last can of meat.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Timid Citizen

attributes.content: I'm sorry, I can't carry on. I'm at my limit! This lockdown zone, the dust of the dead floating in the air, this rotting corpse stench, this—everything—
attributes.name: Timid Citizen

attributes.content: I don't understand! Why should I be living out my days like this?!
attributes.name: Timid Citizen

attributes.content: I... I'm someone who means something! I should be waking up to the call of fowl, to a cup of coffee, and then to my writing desk and manuscripts...
attributes.name: Timid Citizen

attributes.content: Why should I—madams, I'm sorry, I'm aware of all the assistance you've afforded me, but...
attributes.name: Timid Citizen

attributes.content: Excuse me, really, please, but this isn't the sort of thing I should be doing. I used to take pride in my virtue—I was wonderful to my servants, I would tip double what anyone else would whenever we went out to eat...
attributes.name: Timid Citizen

attributes.content: I can't carry on. I've had enough, really. I just can't make sense of this, I'm so confused...
attributes.name: Timid Citizen

attributes.content: Then you're free to put down that can you've got, and be out of this place.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I can make a trade with you! I have some gems, Sargon origin, and a Sankta's patron firearm...
attributes.name: Timid Citizen

attributes.content: Which we don't need.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I'm begging you, I'm begging you—
attributes.name: Timid Citizen

attributes.content: The man trembles and shakes harder and harder, until finally his legs give out and he's kneeling on the floor. He's probably never begged someone like this in all his life. He's acting a comedic sight.
He grips his overcoat with white knuckles, so tight the place where he hides the can bulges out. It's like a weeping tumor parasiting off his body. Or an unborn child more loved than it'd ever know.
Get on your way, man. Front door's sealed. You know how to make a balcony exit.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Baird!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Let him go, let him go! Get him the hell out of here, and that stupid bloody can with him! Never to return, why don't you!
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I... I'm worn. I'm done watching this happen anymore.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I never want to see... any of this anymore.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: The timid man hurries to leave, stumbling, hesitating, like he doesn't believe this boxing gym owner-slash-gang member would let him go so easy.
Delphine stares daggers at him. He turned his head, and subconsciously he feels about himself. He doesn't have a thing on him. Notes and coins are worse than useless in Norport these days, to boot.
He grinds his teeth, drops down and leaves that gussied-up pen of his on the floor, then immediately turns and legs it into the darkness.
He's out.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Baird picks the fountain pen up, and with no comment stows it in her pocket.
Delphine.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Come and let's touch heads. Kip for a bit.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Just like the old days, in the video shop.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Young girl. They say you're the merc freshly assigned here?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Soldier

attributes.content: Y... Yeah.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Nice luck, then. You've got an easy job here.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Soldier

attributes.content: All you've gotta do is watch that those Victorian guys don't cross the blockade line. If anyone makes trouble, you kill 'em.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Soldier

attributes.content: Got it!
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Ha! Yeah, let's give those stuck-up Victorians the miserable days they deserve! If I was calling shots, I'd throw them a pile of hatchets or whatever and let them dispatch themselves instead!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Soldier

attributes.content: I... I don't think the brief allows that.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: You know how to rain on a parade, little girl. We're Sarkaz. What does it matter to us if they live or die?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Soldier

attributes.content: We may as well find our own fun where we can.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Soldier

attributes.content: B... But...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: No, whatever. I'm going to take a nap, so you watch this place. If any accidents happen, I've got no reservations about taking your little head off along with theirs.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Soldier

attributes.content: He's gone.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Thank you, girl.
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: I didn't bring much out this time. There's some food, and some medicine...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Oh, that suffices, thank you, thank you.
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: Why is it so weird for me to help you? You're a Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: You're one of us...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: What if we talk to my officer, sir? You don't need to be staying with these Victorians.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: No, no. I've lived here my whole life. This is my home.
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: Londinium is?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Anyplace you go, you find Sarkaz, don't you? I took on running a hotel myself, after you lot arrived here...
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: I've never been to Kazdel, little girl. Is that where you're from?
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: No, I've never been either.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Then where do you call home?
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: Home? I... I'm not that sure. I was born in Columbia, but... my old captain said Kazdel was the real home for us Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Even though you've never set foot there?
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: I... I don't know, but that's what all of them say...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Hah-hah. I don't take much notice of what those soldiers like to tell us. Never mind going out killing with them—I'd rather get that chandelier in my hotel fixed.
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: You should've seen it when it was still in good shape, I'm telling you. A crown of jewels to beat any dame's necklace!
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: Not to mention all the effort I spent as a younger man, hands-on, polishing that thing to a spit-shine!
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: You... You sure are one weird Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Is it strange to be more fond of light fixtures than murder? I'm sorry, I confess I've never had much contact with mercenaries...
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: But it more than comforts me that there are kindhearted girls like you who'd bring supplies for me out here.
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: Bye for now, child. I can't stay around here too long. If you ever get the chance in future, you must come pay a visit to my hotel.
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: Forty, even thirty years ago, when Norport was still singing with life, the hotel on Sunset Street was the best place in all of Londinium to be!
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: I... I will.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Maybe... once we're done with this war?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Hah-hah. Good! You'll have a secret invitation from me to try our best desserts!
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: Shatter.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Such witchery has no purchase against us, Banshee. You've made more than enough attempts over these past days.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: It is time wasted. A true grasp of our cluster's nature is not yours.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Your knowledge is wholly attained from study. Altogether parched is your personal experience.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Perhaps, you should lay down your pen of bone for one moment? We would like simply to take a walk with you.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: In the words of a good Viscount we once became, this city offers no better time than the present.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Walk slow. The footpaths about the city center are Londinium's pride.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Damazti, what fate is it you wish to elect for yourself?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: You're profuse with incarnations and transformations. You believe death is always yours to outrun.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I will perform your elegy, for you in your whole.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Please, don't look to scare us, Banshee. We know the methods at your disposal.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: We simply point out that an individual's death is not the end to us, just as a city does not metamorphose for a street's removal, nor does a civilization collapse for a written script's vanishing.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Yet any civilization will languish and decline.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: And thus, we value the renewal, the experience.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: We knew close to every one of your forebears, Banshee. All once were young, and all once were greatly, ardently aspirational as you are now.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Perhaps there's no other way it should be. Perhaps it is by the elegy, the dirge, that transformation should be begotten.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: But they all became as dust in the end. Your cohort likewise cannot flee the knell at your nape.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Does your experience still draw you to that flame of ruination's side?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: No. No, it doesn't.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Already we have searched for countless years, and still we search. For different looks, for different places.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: You are an extraordinary master of witchcraft.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: May we bid you to grant this olden memory a pittance of a stage set?
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: We... I sunk into Sargon's sea of sands for a hundred years. The time when the King of Kings' expedition had only just come to a close.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: Such exploits call to you to follow in their wake. Especially before they've fully passed into legend.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: Banshee, stir those sandstorms for me, a Fata Morgana though it may be.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: I ask a meager moment of your precious time. Come seek my origins with me.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: Let us submerse in them. Let us trek together. Maybe you'll understand me, or maybe I'll find myself in you.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: Prove yourself to me.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: We will reach a conclusion, Damazti.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Curtains.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Of course, obviously, this doesn't quite match up with what remnant memories I have, but I can't blame you. The wind scours all too many traces.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: It was here I built people's houses. Newfangled wonders like nomadic cities weren't yet to be, and the houses built of stones ultimately vanished into thin air within the sandstorms.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: Built, then destroyed, built, then destroyed...
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: Most might tire after facing such a cycle, but in it, I was happy.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: You likened this to civilization. This is the 'renewal' you so enjoy?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: No, not enjoy.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: That was a sloppy metaphor, no more. Ultimately, there is a construction to every civilization, and an ending.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: And yet I possess neither, though I so yearn to.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: You aren't a stone. You're sand.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: ...Sand.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: Yes, Banshee. I am sand.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: Unable to be constructed. Its very own end.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: A state you're not content with.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I once became as a lord ameer's countenance, and met the King of Kings of that era. He proclaimed himself 'The Shah of Past and Future,' that all answers to all creation lay in his golden trove of treasures.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: I asked him: Your Majesty, what meaning is there to all we surround ourselves with? Where will you lead us?
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: He lifted his head high, and proclaimed to me: My very thought is Meaning.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: Such was his arrogance, his egotism, that basking in the light of the afternoon sun, he believed himself Civilization's ruler.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: But all I could see was that, comically, he'd trodden on a corner of his own cloak.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: I was bored. And so I departed the place.
attributes.name: 'Sargonian'

attributes.content: I'm very struck by the dukes' methods.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Our squad's not a small one... but you infiltrated like you were walking into your own backyard.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Those quick grapples of yours, and the mini illusion Units... No wonder you got your own Londinium intelligence network established under Sarkaz control this strict.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: You're free enough you can move between Londinium and this disused plate however you want.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Victoria's the most formidable nation in these lands, and the Duke I'm loyal to is Victoria's worthiest of note.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: It's only natural we'd have our whole gallery of Arts tricks readied.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.options: Hope you don't turn them on us.

attributes.content: The Duke of Caster treats her friends very dearly.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The airship's hidden somewhere on this plate. By our estimates, there should be an underground dock here.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Nothing more concrete?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: We'll leave it up to you.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You've got a little time before old Wellington and General Nachzehrer start testing each other's strength, but a little's all you've got.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I'm trusting you all to wrap this up in a satisfactory way. For me.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: And don't forget. This is a trade, Your Royal Highness Alexandrina, and you, Doctor of Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'
